New Records: LeBron James and Max Christie combined to score 66 points, Christie finishing with a career-best 28
James made a season-high seven three-pointers, needing only 10 attempts, on his way to 38 points
James' 38-point game tied him with Michael Jordan for most 30-point games in NBA history
It was also the third-most points ever scored by a player after turning 40 (behind two Jordan games)
James was also the second-oldest player ever to make seven threes in a game (Vince Carter did that when he was 42)
Key Match Events: Christie hit five threes and aggressively cut off the ball with the Portland defense focused on James and Austin Reaves
Reaves finished with 11 assists, eight rebounds and 15 points
Anfernee Simons led Portland with 23 points
Pre-Game Insights: Without Anthony Davis and Gabe Vincent, the Lakers needed a big night from someone they rely on and a career night from someone they're truly starting to
Redick emphasized the importance of strong perimeter defense and shot readiness for LeBron James
Post-Match Reflections: Christie expressed pride in his team's effort after the comeback win
James expressed pride in his team's effort after the comeback win
Miscellaneous Highlights: A couple of missed mid-range jumpers had Christie ready to 'wring his neck'
The Lakers hosted Atlanta on Friday night before playing key road games against Houston and Dallas
